data.title: Bob Corritore ‚Äì Official Website
data.meta_description: CLICK HERE TO VIEW NEWSLETTER ARCHIVES FROM PREVIOUS YEARS December 31 - First show of the year tomorrow! New album releases for early 2022! Spider in numerous Best Of Year lists! First show of 2022 on January 1! Bob Corritore‚Äòs ‚ÄúFrom The Vaults‚Äù series continues with 2 brilliant forthcoming releases! Louisiana Red & Bob Corritore/Tell‚Ä¶
data.text:
2021 Archives

CLICK HERE TO VIEW NEWSLETTER ARCHIVES FROM PREVIOUS YEARS

December 31 ‚Äì First show of the year tomorrow! New album releases for early 2022! Spider in numerous Best Of Year lists!

First show of 2022 on January 1!

Bob Corritore‚Äòs ‚ÄúFrom The Vaults‚Äù series continues with 2 brilliant forthcoming releases!

Louisiana Red & Bob Corritore/Tell Me ‚ÄòBout It.

Release date February 18, 2022.

Bob Corritore & Friends/Down Home Blues Revue

with Honeyboy Edwards, T-Model Ford, Henry Townsend, Big Jack Johnson, Robert ‚ÄúBilbo‚Äù Walker, Smokey Wilson, Tomcat Courtney, Dave Riley, Pecan Porter, & Al Garrett.

Release date March 4, 2022.

Pre-order now: https://ffm.to/bobcdownhome

And please don‚Äôt forget about some of the other great Vaults releases!

Best Of 2021 Listings!

We are absolutely delighted to see Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew included in these Best Of 2021 listings:

December 29, 2021 ‚Äì Farewell 2021, The Year In Review

Despite a pandemic roller coaster ride of a year, we are thankful for the many things we were able to accomplish in this ever-changing world. While we scramble to adapt to the constantly changing protocols and we morn the losses of some great musicians and friends, we are grateful for the blessings and achievement. Thank you so much for your kindness and support. Let‚Äôs all look forward to the promise of the new year! Here is a pictorial review of some of the highlights from the year 2021. Blessings to you!

Thank you Tomiko Dixon (granddaughter of Willie Dixon) for a wonderful cover story/interview/pictorial in Lazie Indie Magazine.

8 page feature from Soul Bag Magazine in France!

Bob Corritore‚Äòs song ‚ÄúHarmonica Watusi‚Äù was featured in the soundtrack of the Netflix series Cowboy Bebop (Season 1, episode 5).

Thank you to VizzTone Label Group, BratGirl Media, all of the writers and publications for the great reviews, features and mentions, the DJs for the amazing airplay, the great fans, friends and supporters, the many fantastic musicians who I am so honored to make music with, the great studio, sound and graphics people who‚Äôs magic enhances everything, KJZZ radio, The Rhythm Room and awesome manager Lynsey Curtis, the great artists, labels and promoters who included my harmonica on their projects, JC3 Music Placement, my webmasters Jeff Taylor and Bentley Monet, and the good lord for all of life‚Äôs blessings!

December 22, 2021 ‚Äì Happy Holidays, Merry Christmas and Season‚Äôs Greetings from the Bob Corritore Blues Newsletter!

Thank you so much for your support and cherished friendship! Wishing you love, health, safety, and good music! Bob and crew!

üéÑ üéÅ üéÖ

Top row standing: Ben Levin, Willie Buck, Bob Margolin, Wes Starr, Alabama Mike, Jimi ‚ÄúPrimetime‚Äù Smith. Bottom row seated: Adrianna Marie, Bob Stroger, Diunna Greenleaf, Bob Corritore, L.A. Jones. Photo by Marilyn Stringer.

December 10, 2021 ‚Äì Award Nominations & Voting Info!

ROCK AND BLUES MUSE AWARDS!

Voting is open now through December 15 for the TOP 20 ALBUMS OF 2021 and Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew is nominated! You can vote here.

BLUES LOUNGE RADIO SHOW AWARDS!

Also voting is now open in the 2021 Blues Lounge Radio Show Awards.

Bob Corritore is nominated in two categories, for Harmonica and for the album Spider In My Stew!

Thanks everyone! Your fantastic love and support has made these nominations happen! Wishing everybody a blessed holiday season!

November 17, 2021 ‚Äì Rhythm Room Appearance On Saturday! Song In Netflix Series Soundtrack Debuts Friday! Preview Of 2022 CD Releases!

The Jimi Primetime Smith/Bob Corritore Blues Band appears Saturday, November 20 at the Rhythm Room, 1019 E. Indian School Rd. Phoenix, AZ 85257. Some heavy Chicago style blues will be played. Click here for info and tickets.

Bob Corritore song in soundtrack of Netflix series episode!

Netflix live action adaptation of the Cowboy Bebop anime debuts on Friday with Bob Corritore‚Äôs song Harmonica Watusi in the soundtrack. The song will appear in episode 105 ‚ÄúDarkside Tango.‚Äù It‚Äôs very exciting to have music played on this huge mainstream platform!

2022 Releases! Bob Corritore plans three new releases for next year. The first two will be a continuation of all the recordings on Bob‚Äôs Vaults Series.

On February 18, 2022 ‚Äì Louisiana Red & Bob Corritore/Tell Me ‚ÄòBout It. This album features mostly unreleased material recorded between 2000 and 2009. Powerful performance by Red and Bob with amazing backing by Chico Chism, David Maxwell, Bob Margolin, Little Victor‚Äôs Juke Joint, Buddy Reed, Johnny Rapp, Chris James and Patrick Rynn, Brian Fahey.

On March 4th, 2022 ‚Äì Bob Corritore & Friends/Down Home Blues Revue. This collection features an amazing array of deep southern voices performing some sweet down home blues. The album features performances by Honeyboy Edwards, T-Model Ford, Henry Townsend, Big Jack Johnson, Robert ‚ÄúBilbo‚Äù Walker, Smokey Wilson, Tomcat Courtney, Dave Riley, Pecan Porter, Al Garrett. All but one track on this album are previously unreleased. We are excited about this, the second batch in Bob‚Äôs Vaults series, and we look forward to many more releases of this wonderful older material that needs to be heard.

And then in fall of 2022, look for an album of all newly recorded material that will called Bob Corritore & Friends/You Shocked Me. Appearing on this album will be Diunna Greenleaf, Alabama Mike, Willie Buck, Bill and Shy Perry, Bob Margolin, Bob Stroger, Oscar Wilson, Johnny Rawls, Francine Reed, Jimi Primetime Smith, Sugaray Rayford, Kid Ramos, Johnny Main, The Fremonts, Adrianna Marie, L.A. Jones, Fred Kaplan, Ben Levin and more! Exciting stuff exploring numerous blues stylings.

We look forward to debuting these album covers and providing pre-order links soon!

These 2022 albums will be released on VizzTone Label Group/SWMAF Records with Brat Girl Media promoting!

November 3, 2021 ‚Äì Spider In My Stew Grammy News, Lazie Indie Magazine Cover Story, Podcast Interview and more

For Your Grammy Consideration: Bob Corritore & Friends / Spider In My Stew

For your Grammy consideration Bob Corritore & Friends / Spider In My Stew featuring an amazing array of special guests: Lurrie Bell, Sugaray Rayford, John Primer, Johnny Rawls, Oscar Wilson, Bill and Shy Perry, Alabama Mike, Diunna Greenleaf, Francine Reed, Junior Watson, Kid Ramos, Willie Buck, Bob Margolin, LA Jones, Adrianna Marie, Johnny Main, The Fremonts and more!

Lazie Indie Magazine Cover Story!

Cool interview with Tomiko Dixon, the granddaughter of Willie Dixon! To see the entire article click here!

Podcast interview!

Thank you to Rick Troutman for posting this interview on his show, Got Blues If You Want It, which you can see by clicking here.

Bob Corritore song to appear on the Netflix series Cowboy Bebop!

Bob Corritore‚Äòs ‚ÄúHarmonica Watusi‚Äù will be part of the soundtrack of the new Netflix live action adaptation of the Anime series Cowboy Bebop. The series debuts on November 19! You may know the song ‚ÄúHarmonica Watusi‚Äù from the album Taboo. We have no idea if this song will be way in the background or used prominently, but it‚Äôs very exciting! Thank you to JC3 Music for the placement!

Hurricane Relief Blues Harmonica Compilation released online today!

Low Blows for Ida is an album of acoustic unaccompanied harmonica songs by the best blues harmonica players in the world today. Organized by Tucson, Arizona harp man Tom Walbank, it came about through Tom‚Äôs frustration with what he could and couldn‚Äôt do to help when he heard about the havoc caused by Hurricane Ida. As a dad, he wasn‚Äôt able to drop everything and go to Louisiana and help rebuild, but as a musician, he could pick up the phone and get in touch with other musicians who might be able to help. The result is an incredible array of top talent from around the world, a real love letter to the instrument. All proceeds of this album go to Hurricane Ida relief in Louisiana and Mississippi. Click here to purchase the album. Bob Corritore has 2 songs featured on this album!

October 21, 2021 ‚Äì Chicago Showcase At The Rhythm Room On Saturday, Recent Awards & Recognition

This Saturday the Jimi Primetime Smith/Bob Corritore Blues Band plus special guests Carl Weathersby and Carla Denise. Doors at 7pm music at 8pm.

Bob Corritore has received some great honors as of late:

October 12, 2021 ‚Äì Shows In Tucson This Weekend & Phoenix Next Weekend

Gonna be a couple of blues parties for you to enjoy!

September 20 ‚Äì Bob Corritore‚Äôs Birthday Party & Spider In My Stew CD Release Party This Saturday!

This Saturday, September 25, Bob Corritore will have his annual blues birthday bash which will also serve as a CD release party for Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew!

Included at this party will be a lineup of many of the amazing musicians who performed on the critically acclaimed album! Plus you can expect a surprise special guest or two! CDs and T-shirts will be available for purchase! And as an extra treat on this night, Bob Corritore will be formally inducted into the Arizona Musician and Entertainer Hall Of Fame with a presentation immediately following the first set!

This all takes place at the Bob‚Äôs recently reopened Rhythm Room which is celebrating it‚Äôs 30th anniversary this month!

The Rhythm Room is located at 1019 E. Indian School Rd., Phoenix, AZ 85014.

August 6 ‚Äì Blues Blast Music Awards Voting Ends Today!

Blues Blast Music Awards voting ends TODAY. Please consider casting your vote today at www.bluesblastmagazine.com.

Bob Corritore has three albums up for an award!

1) Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew is nominated for Best Traditional Blues Recording

2) Henry Gray & Bob Corritore/Cold Chills is nominated for Best Historical Vintage Recording

3) Kid Ramos & Bob Corritore/Phoenix Blues Sessions is also nominated for Historical Vintage Recording

Thanks everyone for your support and for loving the blues. Please vote your choices today. Voting is hoping to everyone, and takes just a few minutes! www.bluesblastmagazine.com.

August 4 ‚Äì Blues Blast Music Awards Voting Ends Friday!

Blues Blast Music Awards voting ends Friday, August 6. Please consider casting your vote today at www.bluesblastmagazine.com.

Bob Corritore has three albums up for an award!

1) Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew is nominated for Best Traditional Blues Recording

2) Henry Gray & Bob Corritore/Cold Chills is nominated for Best Historical Vintage Recording

3) Kid Ramos & Bob Corritore/Phoenix Blues Sessions is also nominated for Historical Vintage Recording

Thanks everyone for your support and for loving the blues. Please vote your choices today. Voting is hoping to everyone, and takes just a few minutes! www.bluesblastmagazine.com.

July 15 ‚Äì Blues Blast Music Awards, Living Blues Charts, Rhythm Room Reopening and More!

Blues Blast Music Awards Voting Happening Now! Three of Bob Corritore‚Äòs projects are up for awards!

Voting has begun and continues until August 6, 2021 at BluesBlastMagazine.com. Voting is free and open to anyone. You may only vote one time. If you are not currently a subscriber you are automatically signed up as a subscriber to our free magazine as part of the voting process. Thank you Blues Blast Magazine.

Bob Corritore & Friends / Spider In My Stew is #1 on the Living Blues Radio Chart for the 2nd month in a row!

It is an unprecedented honor to see this release at the top of the chart for two consecutive months. Thanks everyone for this amazing acceptance! A great honor!

Rhythm Room Reopens August 27th!

After a year and a half of closure due to the Covid pandemic, the Rhythm Room triumphantly reopens on August 27! The Atomic Road Kings grace the opening night with their CD Release party. And September marks the 30th anniversary of Phoenix‚Äôs legendary roots and blues venue. The new website is up and running and you can buy advance tickets to most shows online! The Jimi Primetime Smith/Bob Corritore Blues Band with special guests George Bowman and Sugaray Rayford will appear as part of a huge lineup at the Rhythm Room Re-Launch Party on September 4th. And don‚Äôt forget about Bob Corritore‚Äôs star-studded Birthday / CD Release Party on Sept 25! Complete information about these and other shows as well as advance ticket purchase at www.rhythmroom.com.

Catbluz Radio Hour features Bob Corritore on Tuesday, Sept 21!

An hour of music and interview with your host Catfish! Tuesday, September 21, 7pm PST.

S.E. Willis with guest Bob Corritore appear Thursday, July 22 in Flagstaff, Arizona next week!

Enjoy an intimate, early evening performance of Blues and Roots music with S.E. Willis and guest Bob Corritore appearing 6 to 9 pm at Charly‚Äôs at the Hotel Weatherford. You may recognize the name S.E. Willis as the longtime piano player with Elvin Bishop. Bob is looking forward to seeing his Flagstaff friends again soon!

July 7 ‚Äì Awards, Nominations, Podcast, Magazine Feature, CD Release Party!

John Primer & Bob Corritore / The Gypsy Woman Told Me album wins Living Blues Award!

Thank you Living Blues Magazine for this honor! Winner of a 2021 Living Blues Award for Best New Recording / Contemporary Blues.

Blues Blast Music Awards Annouced! Three of Bob Corritore‚Äôs projects are nominated! You can vote today!

In June 2021, a group of Blues music industry professionals including music critics, journalists, festival promoters, music venue managers, producers, musicians and other Blues music industry professionals nominated the best in Blues music in twelve categories.

Voting has begun and continues until August 6, 2021 at BluesBlastMagazine.com. Voting is free and open to anyone. You may only vote one time. If you are not currently a subscriber you are automatically signed up as a subscriber to our free magazine as part of the voting process.

Blues Blast Magazine subscriptions are always FREE and you may unsubscribe at any time at the bottom of each issue! The nominees are listed here. Thank you Blues Blast Magazine!

Bob Corritore featured on Happy Hour Harmonica Podcast!

Thank you to Neil Warren for this beautiful interview. Quite an honor to be included in the series! Click here to enjoy the podcast.

France‚Äôs amazing Soul Bag Magazine features Bob Corritore article! Thank you to Christophe Mourot for this stunning 8 page article!

Congratulations John Primer, winner 2021 Blues Music Award for Best Traditional Male Blues Artist.

Save The Date! Gonna be a party!

Advance tickets at www.rhythmroom.com.

June 14 ‚Äì Living Blues Awards Voting Ends Tomorrow!

Please consider voting in the 2021 Living Blues Awards! Voting ends tomorrow, Tuesday, June 15 at midnight central time. Voting is open to the public and takes about five or 10 minutes to complete. Go to www.livingblues.com, scroll down and click the vote graphic. Thanks!

June 10 ‚Äì Less Than One Week To Vote For The Living Blues Awards

Voting is open to the public until June 15. You can vote now at www.livingblues.com.

Bob Corritore & Friends / Spider In My Stew is #1 on the Living Blues Radio Chart May 2021!

Thank you to all the DJs for spinning this album!

Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew is #1 in the Roots Music Report Top 50 Blues Album Chart!

Other Spider accolades!

And check out the over 25 rave reviews from all around the world by clicking here.

T-shirts and autographed CD are available directly from Bob.

You can contact Bob directly at bobcorritore@yahoo.com to go over purchase details.

A Message From Bill & Shy Perry!

In-depth Bob Corritore interview on the Happy Hour Harmonica Podcast.

Thank you to host Neil Warren! Click here to listen.

John Primer wins Blues Music Award for Best Traditional Male Blues Artist!

But was that ever in question? Photo by Eric Kriesant.

Thank you for all the love! We love you all back!

May 11 ‚Äì Jimi Primetime Smith/Bob Corritore Play Friday In Tucson!

Attention Tucson! This Friday the Jimi ‚ÄúPrimetime‚Äú Smith/Bob Corritore Blues band perform an open-air, outdoor show at Monterey Court in Tucson! Chicago Blues music from 7 PM until 10 PM with great food and drinks! We‚Äôve been itching to get out and play! And the CD Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew will be available for purchase as well as T-Shirts! We hope to see you Friday!

May 8 ‚Äì Living Blues Award Noms! Spider In My Stew May 14 Release and more!

Living Blues Awards!

This week the list of nominations for the Living Blues Awards was announced. John Primer & Bob Corritore/The Gypsy Woman Told Me is up for Best Blues Album!

Bob Corritore is nominated in an all-star listing in the Blues Harmonica Category. John Primer leads the 2021 LBA‚Äôs with 4 noms in the categories of Album, Male Blues Artist, Guitarist, and Entertainer. It‚Äôs also great to see our close friends and fellow collaborators nominated: Sugaray Rayford, Lurrie Bell, Lil‚Äô Ed and Johnny Rawls. Voting is open to the public right now at www.LivingBlues.com.

New Album Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew to be released May 14 (one week from today)!

Two singles from the album now available for download!

For downloads, click here: https://ffm.to/spiderstew

To pre-order the CD on Amazon click here.

Spider In My Stew T-Shirts Available Now!

Contact Bob Corritore to get pricing and to order your T-shirt at bobcorritore@yahoo.com. Great artwork by the legendary Vince Ray! Inquire about the two previous designs which are also still available!

A Message From Oscar Wilson!

Bob Corritore to be interviewed on Music On The Couch!

Music On The Couch is this coming Monday, May 10, 2021. Bob Corritore‚Äôs 45 minute segment begins at 11:15pm EASTERN (10:15pm Central; 9:15pm Mountain; 8:15pm Pacific).

The direct link to hear the show on Monday is: http://tobtr.com/11937018

There is a Facebook event set at: https://www.facebook.com/events/526513938349947/

Outdoor show in Tucson on May 14!

Spider In My Stew Media Reaction!

We are shocked in the most positive of ways by the incredible reaction to this album! Here we are a week before the release date and we already have a nice list of great reviews which we‚Äôve compiled on our website ‚Äì click here to see! And the album is already charting ‚Äì making #3 on the UK radio chart and #1 in the Classic Blues Chart! More charts and reviews will be coming! Thank you!!!!

April 6 ‚Äì Happy Arizona Gives Day! Please Consider A Donation To Southwest Musical Arts Foundation.

Happy Arizona Gives Day! Please consider a donation to Southwest Musical Arts Foundation. These are very tough times and we realize that many of you will not have the resources to donate. But if you do have the means, every bit of your donation will go towards preparation of the next batch of Vaults recordings. We have master tapes from over 100 sessions recorded over three decades that we feel need to be released. Many of the artists that we documented are no longer with us. We have been transferring numerous sessions from various formats (tape and hard drive) to ProTools format. We will be releasing batches of 3 or 4 albums annually if we can afford to do this. We are looking at unreleased material by Louisiana Red, Pinetop Perkins, Luther Tucker, Smokey Wilson, Robert Lockwood, Eddie Kirkland, Big Jack Johnson, Robert Bilbo Walker, Honeyboy Edwards, Carol Fran, Sam Lay, Magic Slim and much more! But all of this involves attention to detail as well as the huge expense of studio time. Each $100 donation brings us about an hour and a half of studio time so you can imagine how that adds up. If you do have the means a desire for a donation please either send by PayPal or mail.

The PayPal link is:

The mailing address is:

Southwest Musical Arts P.O. Box 3310 Scottsdale, AZ 85271

Please make the check out to Southwest Musical Arts Foundation.

Thank you to everyone for all the support! Look for many more future volumes from the Vaults Series!

March 12 ‚Äì New Bob Corritore & Friends Album Coming May 14

NEW ALBUM! Be on the lookout for a May 14, 2021 release of all newly-recorded material called Bob Corritore & Friends/Spider In My Stew.

It features an amazing array of guests: Lurrie Bell, Sugaray Rayford, John Primer, Johnny Rawls, Oscar Wilson, Bill and Shy Perry, Alabama Mike, Diunna Greenleaf, Francine Reed, Junior Watson, Kid Ramos, Willie Buck, Bob Margolin, LA Jones, Adrianna Marie, Johnny Main, Fremonts, Bob Stroger, Fred Kaplan, Doug James.

This new album might be Bob‚Äôs best so far! Such a wide array of talent, wonderful songs, and everyone gave heartfelt performances. Plus it features some of Bob‚Äôs coolest harmonica playing to date! And check out the amazing album art by famous illustrator Vince Ray! To see the complete album artwork with all panels, click here.

Right now you can just pre-order the downloads, but in a week or so you should also be able to pre-order the CDs! And if you‚Äôre interested in buying a T-shirt with this design, we can sell that to you right now! Just reply to this email if you are interested!

March 9 ‚Äì The Gypsy Woman Told Me Is Living Blues Magazine #2 Album Of 2020!

John Primer & Bob Corritore / The Gypsy Woman Told Me is the Living Blues Magazine #2 album of 2020! It‚Äôs truly a wonderful honor for this wonderful album to receive. After many glowing reviews and much radio airplay this recognition is an incredible honor. Thank you Living Blues Magazine!

January 11 ‚Äì New Bob Stroger Photo Tribute Page!

Bob Stroger defines Chicago blues electric bass playing. He has worked with all of the greats in the business including Otis Rush, Sunnyland Slim, Jimmy Rogers, Louis Myers, Snooky Pryor, Billy Boy Arnold, Bob Margolin, John Primer, Pinetop Perkins, Hubert Sumlin, Willie ‚ÄúBig Eyes‚Äù Smith and so many more. He is also a fine singer. Bob Stroger recently celebrated his 90th birthday and he‚Äôs still in the prime of his playing! Born in Hayti, Missouri on December 27, 1930. He moved with his family to Chicago at age 16 and fell in with Blues! His great bass playing has been in demand since the 1970s. Please enjoy this photo gallery honoring the great Bob Stroger! We present a collection of numerous photos of Bob through the years in some of the most magnificent and legendary blues bands. To enjoy this photo tribute page click here.

Please note that if you have any cool photos of Bob Stroger please send them by for possible inclusion. Please send the highest possible resolution. We are especially looking for any photos from the American Folk Blues Festival from years 1980 and 1981.
